TopicTitle: How do you give the engines an angle?

Articles.Content: I have noticed that some people are able to make space shuttles with the SSMEs angled slightly away from the axial direction, just like the real thing. How do you do that?! I've been trying to build shuttles, and that is still eluding me.
My best guess is with cubic octagonal struts and the use of shift+WASD (depending on direction) but seeing as how I've never actually tried this I don't really know.
Yes, using the Cubic Octagonal Struts works just fine.
I ~think~ that you can use the BZ-52 Radial Attachment Points too; I've never tried doing this, but I'm pretty sure that they work fine and might look better than the struts
I used large girders just so it is easy to discern. Any part that allows fuel crossfeed and can be mounted radially will work.
